Core Concepts.commentary: The seeds of thought and being. These words root our speech in the most fundamental ideas — life, death, self, nothingness. Use them sparingly and with intention. Emotions & States.commentary: Feelings are rivers that carve the landscape of our lives. These words name those currents. Speak them to name your inner weather. Kinship & People.commentary: No one walks alone. Here are the names for those who share your path — family, friends, strangers — and all the bonds that bind you. Nature.commentary: Stones, trees, beasts, and sky. This cluster grounds you in the living world. Learn these names to honour the spirits you meet. English Source Ancient Librán Notes Bear Lat. ursus — Strength ; singular ursa, definite ursë, plural ursir Boar IS. göltr — Rage ; singular goltra, definite goltrë, plural goltrir Boar IS. göltr — Wildness ; singular golta, definite goltë, plural goltir Cat Lat. felis — Mystical ; singular felira, definite felirë, plural felirir Crow Lat. corvus — Scavenger ; singular corvua, definite corvuë, plural corvuir Crow Lat. corvus — Death bird ; singular corva, definite corvë, plural corvir Deer Rom. cerb — Grace ; singular cerba, definite cerbë, plural cerbir English Source Modern Librán (root) Notes Bear Lat. ursus ursa Strength ; singular ursa, definite ursë, plural ursir Boar IS. göltr goltra Rage ; singular goltra, definite goltrë, plural goltrir Boar IS. göltr golta Wildness ; singular golta, definite goltë, plural goltir Cat Lat. felis felira Mystical ; singular felira, definite felirë, plural felirir Crow Lat. corvus corvua Scavenger ; singular corvua, definite corvuë, plural corvuir
